intro: Elaeoselinum thapsioides, commonly known as the sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers and silver-blue foliage, which are adapted to thrive in coastal and saline environments. The plant produces small, spherical seed heads that are often used in ornamental gardening. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is known for its aromatic properties. Elaeoselinum thapsioides is typically found growing in rocky soils and along coastal dunes.
